bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn was a fraternal organization organized in 1821 and incorporated in 1825. Its aim was to aid widows, orphans, and distressed members. Ropemaking was one of Brooklyn's largest industries in the 19th century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one record book containing the printed articles of incorporation and rules and regulations of the Rope Makers' Benevolent Society of Brooklyn, as well as a handwritten roll of members. Also included are a photographic negative and print of a cloth emblem of the Society.
